subject: Public Speaking
title: Wiesel's The Perils of Indifference
description: A quick, practical guide to Wiesel's The Perils of Indifference.

hook.text: In 1999, Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel stood in the White House and accused the world of indifference.

buildup.text: He argued that indifference to suffering is worse than anger or hatred, because it means you've stopped caring.

discovery.text: Wiesel said the opposite of love is not hate â€” it's indifference. That line reframed moral responsibility.

twist.text: He delivered it directly to a sitting president, implicitly criticizing American inaction during multiple genocides.

climax.text: The speech forced audiences to confront a hard truth: silence is a choice, and choices have consequences.

quiz.question: What did Elie Wiesel say is the opposite of love?
